_inspectorSnowReport.Report:
2/21/26 1:00 PM Update:  Wow it is nuking out there! We've received a couple inches already with deeper wind filled pockets to be found. Moderate winds persisit but we've yet to have any lifts go on wind hold. It's more important now than ever to respect all terrain closures as tempting as they might be. Although we're back in snow, unmarked hazards and variable conditions still exist. Ride with a buddy, and ski and ride in control. Come enjoy some afternoon POW! Night skiing continues until 7pm tonight on Quicksilver and Discovery through tomorrow.
Terrain Parks: Discovery Park and the Arwine's Jump Line are open today.

A reminder that parking reservations are not required for arrivals afternoon, and carpooling is always encouraged, with priority parking in C-Lot on weekends for cars with 4 or more people. Today, we've got some giveaways (Crystal buffs and stickers) for the first 20 or so carpooler cars to arrive to the mountain as a thank you!  

Events: 
  • Today, Feb. 21th, we have a live DJ Performance from Kendoll from 1pm to 4pm. Rafters Happy Hour is on from 3-5pm with games and specials as well!
  • From February 20th-22nd join us for Military Appreciation Weekend. Kick off the day with hot cocoa in the gondola plaza with our friends from Mission Outdoors. Learn about the day's activities, meet new friends, and enjoy exploring all Crystal has to offer. 
Notes for today:
  1. $199 Spring 3-Day Passes are on sale now! Ski for just $67 a day, any day of the week, for the rest of the season!
  2. Night Skiing hours have been adjusted to 4:00 p.m. to 7 p.m.
  3. Weve decided to discontinue the parking waitlist for the 25/26 season. Parking reservations are back to first-come, first-served basis, and still required on weekends and holidays
  4. $62 Day tickets continue every Tuesday for the remainder of the season!
  5. Did you know it just takes 5 Days to be entered to win a 26/27 Ikon Pass? Track your days on the Ikon App and register for RIDE TO WIN
  6. Looking to save time and make the most of the day? Consider grabbing a Daily Reserve Upgrade! Available on weekends and holidays, this upgrade grants access to priority lift lines, getting you on the lift faster and allowing you to complete more laps. 
  7. Paid reservations can only be cancelled by emailing SP+ at  CrystalMtnParking@spplus.com with Reservation #, First Name, and Last Name. While you may not receive an immediate reply, the cancellation will be processed. The Crystal Mountain Contact Center cannot process these cancellations.
  8. In case of on-mountain emergency: Call 360-663-3064 or 911

Mountain Weather 2/21/2026 3:30pm 

Forecaster: Bradford Swanson

Synopsis: A strong low-pressure system has come to a screeching halt off the Washington coast. This large mass of cold air is mixing with the moisture-laden air from the southern Pacific, resulting in a proper snowstorm heading our way. Sunday is looking to be a feisty storm day with 3-6 of new snow expected, but more impactful will certainly be the winds. With this low-pressure system sitting off our coast, it is drumming up some very cranky winds that could easily peg the 60mph mark near the ridgelines. 

Sunday Night marks the peak intensity of the system with 4-8 of snow likely. As this fizzles out, winds will shift to the Southwest, putting us back into the shadow of good ole Mt. Rainier. Overall, this will mark a very significant storm for Crystal.     
 
Saturday Night:  
Sky Cover: Cloudy
Freezing Elevation: 3,500
12hr Precip: Trace-2
Wind Trends: Strong South Southeast, Gusting 40mph
Sunday: 
Sky Cover: Cloudy
Freezing Elevation: 5,000
12hr Precip: 3-6
Wind Trends: Strong to Extreme South Southeast, gusting 50mph+ 
Sunday Night:  
Sky Cover: Cloudy
Freezing Elevation: 4,500
12hr Precip: 4-8
Wind Trends: Strong South, gusting 30mph 

Outlook: Monday we will continue to have moderate snow showers, as we wring out whatever moisture is left in the clouds. Additionally as this storm progresses, winds will finally start to calm and blow out of the West. West flow at Crystal can be quite productive, often resulting in snow totals that exceed expectations due to orographic enhancement. 

Uphill Travel Update: See the above banner for the current status. Please visit guest services to get your 25/26 uphill travel card. This must be renewed free of charge for the season. Uphill travel may be prohibited at any time as mountain operations teams conduct avalanche mitigation. Refer to the "No Uphill Travel" lights around the base area and the Mountain Report page indicating the status of the designated route. These lights are located by the Gondola trail map, at the bottom of Chinook, at the bottom of Discovery, and at the top of the Quicksilver lift shack. For more information about uphill travel, please visit the uphill travel page. 

25/26 WINTER PROGRAMS, CLINICS, AND NECESSITIES

  • Ski and Ride School: Explore our programs and find the right fit for you.
  • AIARE Course & Certification: Ski the backcountry with expert knowledge and certification
  • Seasonal Gear storage: Hassle-free on-mountain storage with limited availability. Lock your space in today!
  • Seasonal Lockers: For you or your entire family, check out options today.
  • Full Day Seasonal Lesson Programs for 4-6 year olds are now available- with lunch included too!  Secure your spot. Already signed up for a 2-hour session and want to upgrade? No problemjust call us at 833-279-7895
